description: After a late-night conversation with Alex the bartender, Lenart Kova privately resolves to back Oksana Lintz’s proposal for a citywide BCI amnesty, believing the city needs a genuine reset instead of further crackdowns.
Kova meets with Lintz to finalize the plan. They quietly enlist technical support to implement a two-week reset of BCI scores and pause compliance triggers, bypassing opposition from the Directorate.

Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova jointly announce a two-week 'score amnesty,' temporarily resetting all BCI profiles to neutral and inviting citizens to participate in open discussions about the system’s future. Protests subside as public attention turns to reform forums.
Neighborhood forums and assemblies spring up across Stenograd. Residents and ghost citizens openly share experiences with BCI abuses, building momentum for lasting changes.
The Council splits over next steps as the amnesty period nears its end. The Directorate threatens withdrawal if the reset continues, while public support for transparency and BCI overhaul grows.
